ATTN CHARTERING DESK
DEAR SIR
GOOD DAY
DIRECT OWNERS VESSEL
PLEASE ADVISE SUITABLE CARGO FOR BELOW VESSEL

MV.  WANG  DA - 38K/16 - OPEN JEDDAH - ARD 12-13TH SEPT 2024  IAGW,
NO IRAN/ISRAEL/YEMAN,
PREFER BUSINESS TO CHINA DIRECTLY,
TRY F.E OR S.E.ASIA
MV

 WANG DA 
PANAMA FLAG,NKK CLASS, 2016 BLT

SUMMER DWT 38225 MT BSS 10.60M/TPC 51.7MT

GT/NT 24750/12765,TPC 51.7

LOA/BEAM: 179.90 /30.00M

4*36MT CRANE ,4*(6-12)CBM GRAB(REMOTE CONTROL)

G/B (BSS TWN DEC OPEN) 45108.80CBM/NIL

G/B(BSS TWN DECK CLOSED) 46516.30/44728.8CBM

HOLD 2&4 TWIN DECK (FLUSH TD CAN BE REGARDED AS SINGLE DECK FOR BULK CARGO),OTHERS SD

5H/5H

SPEED/ CONSUMPTION:

 

FULL SPEED/CONS:

BALLAST/LADEN ABT 12.50KN/ABT 12.20KN ON ABT 20.00MT IFO 380CST (RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO

 

ECO:

BALLAST/LADEN ABT 11.70KN/ABT 11.70KN ON ABT 17.50MT/ABT 18.00MT IFO 380CST (RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO

 

PORT CONS:IDLE ABT 2.80MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ ABT 0.10MT MDO OR WORKING ABT 3.8MT BSS 12H OR  5.00MT BSS 24H IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO

 

ADDITIONAL ABT 0.5MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380) FOR IDLE OR WORKING IF THE AIR TEMPERATURE IS UNDER 15 CENTIGRADE(INCL)

 

SPEED/CONSUMPTION BASED ON CLEAN BOTTOM ，WITHOUT DECK CARGO AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS WHICH MEANS:WINDS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 / DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3(MAXIMUM SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT 1.25M) AND NO AFFECT OF SEA AND CURRENT AND NO INFLUENCE OF SWELL AND ADVERSE CURRENT."ABT" MEANS 0.5 KN DECREASE IN SPEED & 5% INCREASE IN CONSUMPTION. FAVORABLE CURRENTS ALWAYS WORK TO OWNERS’ ADVANTAGE. ALL PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT ARE CALCULATED ON A GOOD WEATHER DAY BASIS 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS FROM NOON REPORT TO NOON REPORT.NO EXTRAPOLATIONS CAN BE MADE FOR OTHER WEATHER/SEA CONDITIONS THAN THOSE DESCRIBED ABOVE.

 

VESSEL MAY CONSUME EXTRA BUNKER WHEN EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER, HOLDS CLEANING, IN/OUT PORT, IN VERY COLD OR VERY WARM WATER, DURING LIGHTENING OPERATION / DOUBLE BANKING/BUNKERING OR OTHER OPERATIONS WHEN VESSEL NECESSARY TO HAVE THE ENGINE STANDBY OR ADDITIONAL A/E AND BOILER.

 

VESSEL CONSUMES MGO IN MAIN ENGINE, WHEN MANOEUVERING / NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW, NARROW, CONGESTED, RESTRICTED AND CONFINED WATERS / CANALS / RIVERS, ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, WITHIN SECA AREA, AND MAY ALSO BURN MGO WHEN STARTING/SWITCHING OFF AND RUNNING AUXILIARIES AT SEA OR PORT.

 

CHARTERERS SHALL ALSO ENSURE, PRIOR TO THE VESSEL ENTERING IN ANY OF THE EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS),TO SUPPLY THE VESSEL WITH SUFFICIENT QUANTITY OF LOW SULPHUR BUNKERS (THE SULPHUR CONTENT PURSUANT TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF ECAS) TO BE CONSUMED WHEN TRADING IN ECAS AREAS AT CHARTERERS RISK, TIME AND EXPENSES WITHOUT MIXING THIS FUEL WITH OTHER BUNKERS ON BOARD.  IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, "EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS)" MEAN THE AREAS DESIGNATED UNDER MARPOL ANNEX VI AND/OR ANY OTHER AREA WHERE A MAXIMUM FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT IS IMPOSED BY REGIONAL AND/OR NATIONAL AUTHORITIES. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.

 

FUEL OIL TO CONFORM WITH VLSFO-RMG380(MAX SULPHUR:0.5%) (ISO 8217:2017(E) STANDARD) / LSMGO-DMA (EXCEPT PP)(ISO8217:2017(E) STANDARD)(MAX SULPHUR :0.1%). CHARTERTERS SHALL PROVIDE OWNERS/VESSEL BUNKER COQ IN COMPLIANCE WITH ISO 8217:2017 WITH RELIABALE LABORTORY'S STAMP/SIGNATURE NOT LATER THAN 24 HOURS BEFORE COMMENTCEMENT OF BUNKERING, FAILING WHICH ALL CONSEQUENCES/LOSS TO BE ON CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT..

 

ADA 

PLSD TO HEAR.
 
BEST REGARDS,

IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.

SPEED/CONSUMPTION BASED ON CLEAN BOTTOM ，WITHOUT DECK CARGO AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS WHICH MEANS:WINDS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 / DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3(MAXIMUM SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT 1.25M) AND NO AFFECT OF SEA AND CURRENT AND NO INFLUENCE OF SWELL AND ADVERSE CURRENT."ABT" MEANS 0.5 KN DECREASE IN SPEED & 5% INCREASE IN CONSUMPTION. VESSEL MAY CONSUME EXTRA BUNKER WHEN EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER, HOLDS CLEANING, IN/OUT PORT, IN VERY COLD OR VERY WARM WATER, DURING LIGHTENING OPERATION / DOUBLE BANKING/BUNKERING OR OTHER OPERATIONS WHEN VESSEL NECESSARY TO HAVE THE ENGINE STANDBY OR ADDITIONAL A/E AND BOILER.

 

VESSEL CONSUMES MGO IN MAIN ENGINE, WHEN MANOEUVERING / NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW, NARROW, CONGESTED, RESTRICTED AND CONFINED WATERS / CANALS / RIVERS, ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, WITHIN SECA AREA, AND MAY ALSO BURN MGO WHEN STARTING/SWITCHING OFF AND RUNNING AUXILIARIES AT SEA OR PORT.

 

CHARTERERS SHALL ALSO ENSURE, PRIOR TO THE VESSEL ENTERING IN ANY OF THE EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS),TO SUPPLY THE VESSEL WITH SUFFICIENT QUANTITY OF LOW SULPHUR BUNKERS (THE SULPHUR CONTENT PURSUANT TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF ECAS) TO BE CONSUMED WHEN TRADING IN ECAS AREAS AT CHARTERERS RISK, TIME AND EXPENSES WITHOUT MIXING THIS FUEL WITH OTHER BUNKERS ON BOARD.  IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, "EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS)" MEAN THE AREAS DESIGNATED UNDER MARPOL ANNEX VI AND/OR ANY OTHER AREA WHERE A MAXIMUM FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT IS IMPOSED BY REGIONAL AND/OR NATIONAL AUTHORITIES. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.

ECO:

PORT CONS:IDLE ABT 2.80MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ ABT 0.10MT MDO OR WORKING ABT 3.8MT BSS 12H OR  5.00MT BSS 24H IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO
ADDITIONAL ABT 0.5MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380) FOR IDLE OR WORKING IF THE AIR TEMPERATURE IS UNDER 15 CENTIGRADE(INCL)
SPEED/CONSUMPTION BASED ON CLEAN BOTTOM ，WITHOUT DECK CARGO AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS WHICH MEANS:WINDS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 / DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3(MAXIMUM SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT 1.25M) AND NO AFFECT OF SEA AND CURRENT AND NO INFLUENCE OF SWELL AND ADVERSE CURRENT."ABT" MEANS 0.5 KN DECREASE IN SPEED & 5% INCREASE IN CONSUMPTION. FAVORABLE CURRENTS ALWAYS WORK TO OWNERS’ ADVANTAGE. ALL PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT ARE CALCULATED ON A GOOD WEATHER DAY BASIS 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS FROM NOON REPORT TO NOON REPORT.NO EXTRAPOLATIONS CAN BE MADE FOR OTHER WEATHER/SEA CONDITIONS THAN THOSE DESCRIBED ABOVE.
VESSEL MAY CONSUME EXTRA BUNKER WHEN EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER, HOLDS CLEANING, IN/OUT PORT, IN VERY COLD OR VERY WARM WATER, DURING LIGHTENING OPERATION / DOUBLE BANKING/BUNKERING OR OTHER OPERATIONS WHEN VESSEL NECESSARY TO HAVE THE ENGINE STANDBY OR ADDITIONAL A/E AND BOILER.
VESSEL CONSUMES MGO IN MAIN ENGINE, WHEN MANOEUVERING / NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW, NARROW, CONGESTED, RESTRICTED AND CONFINED WATERS / CANALS / RIVERS, ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, WITHIN SECA AREA, AND MAY ALSO BURN MGO WHEN STARTING/SWITCHING OFF AND RUNNING AUXILIARIES AT SEA OR PORT.
CHARTERERS SHALL ALSO ENSURE, PRIOR TO THE VESSEL ENTERING IN ANY OF THE EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS),TO SUPPLY THE VESSEL WITH SUFFICIENT QUANTITY OF LOW SULPHUR BUNKERS (THE SULPHUR CONTENT PURSUANT TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF ECAS) TO BE CONSUMED WHEN TRADING IN ECAS AREAS AT CHARTERERS RISK, TIME AND EXPENSES WITHOUT MIXING THIS FUEL WITH OTHER BUNKERS ON BOARD.  IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, "EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS)" MEAN THE AREAS DESIGNATED UNDER MARPOL ANNEX VI AND/OR ANY OTHER AREA WHERE A MAXIMUM FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT IS IMPOSED BY REGIONAL AND/OR NATIONAL AUTHORITIES. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.
FUEL OIL TO CONFORM WITH VLSFO-RMG380(MAX SULPHUR:0.5%) (ISO 8217:2017(E) STANDARD) / LSMGO-DMA (EXCEPT PP)(ISO8217:2017(E) STANDARD)(MAX SULPHUR :0.1%). CHARTERTERS SHALL PROVIDE OWNERS/VESSEL BUNKER COQ IN COMPLIANCE WITH ISO 8217:2017 WITH RELIABALE LABORTORY'S STAMP/SIGNATURE NOT LATER THAN 24 HOURS BEFORE COMMENTCEMENT OF BUNKERING, FAILING WHICH ALL CONSEQUENCES/LOSS TO BE ON CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT..

THE VESSEL HAS LIBERTY TO BURN EXTRA VLSFO/LSMGO IN CASE OF EMERGENCY, EXCHANGING BALLAST WATER AT SEA, HEATING FUEL IN COLD WEATHER, HOLD CLEANING, MAINTENANCE, MANOEUVRING, SAILING IN SHALLOW/NARROW/CONFINED WATERS, STRAITS, RIVERS, CANAL, ENTERING/LEAVING PORTS, IN HEAVY WEATHER CONDITION AND WHEREVER NECESSARY. COST AND TIME (INCLUDING ANY DEVIATION TIME REQUIRED TO MEET SECA REQUIREMENTS AND/OR REGULATIONS IN OPERATION PORTS TO WHICH VESSEL IS BOUND) INCL BALLAST EXCHANGE TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT.
CHARTERERS TO SUPPLY BUNKERS WITH SPECIFICATIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH VLSFO (SULFUR 0.5% MAX)
ISO 8217:2017 RMG380 AND LSMGO(SULFUR 0.1% MAX) ISO 8217:2017 DMA. BIMCO 2020 MARINE FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT CLAUSE FOR TIME CAHRTER PARTIES TO BE INCORPORATED INTO THIS CP.

SPEED/CONSUMPTION:

AT PORT WORKING: ABOUT 6 MTPD IFO AND ABT 0.1 MTPD MGO
VESSEL MAY CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE FOR WARMING UP OF THE SYSTEM & START/ STOP, AND IN GENERATORS FOR START/CHANGEOVER.
VESSEL MAY ALSO CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE AND GENERATORS FOR
STEAMING IN/OUT OF PORT, SHIFTING BERTH/ANCHORAGE, NAVIGATING IN CONGESTED WATERS/INLAND WATERS/CHANNELS, NARROW WATERWAYS, AND/OR HEAVY TRAFFIC, DURING POOR VISIBILITY; DURING LOAD/DISCHARGING AT ANCHORAGE ON BARGES/LIGHTERS WITH BAD WEATHER AND /OR STRONG CURRENTS AND WHEN VLSFO IS DEEMED UNSAFE BY CHIEF ENGINEER.
FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, VESSEL SPPED/CONSUMPTION IS GIVEN AND DETERMINED BASIS GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS, NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4, AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS, WITH MINIMUM 24 HOURS STEAMING TIME.
ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS
WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.
ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FOR OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.
“ABOUT” IN SPEED AND CONSUMPTION REFERS TO AN ALLOWANCE OF LESS HALF A KNOT IN RELATION TO SPEED AND 5 PERCENT MORE ON BUNKERS CONSUMPTION.
NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES TO WEATHER CONDITIONS EXCEEDING GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS AND NO EXTRAPOLATIONS SHALL BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS. NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES WHEN BURNING RMF/RMG 180.
UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD ANY CLAIM BE DEDUCTED FROM HIRE UNTIL IS HAS BEEN AGREED BY BOTH PARTIES.
VESSEL PARTICIPATES IN BUNKER QUALITY SURVEY (VERIFUEL-BUREAU VERITAS)
BUNKER QUALITY: QUALITY OF BUNKERS SUPPLIED BY CHARTERERS SHALL BE: VLSFO (0.5% MAX SULPHUR)AS PER ISO 8217:2017 OR 2012 AND AS PER ISO PAS 23263:2019 WITH A MINIMUM VISCOSITY OF 3CST AT 50C BUT ALWAYS AS PER M/E SPEC, LSMGO (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AND ALWAYS TO COMPLY WITH MARPOL 73/78 REQUIREMENTS, REG 14, 18 OF ANNEX VI AND ANY SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS THERETO.
WHEN TRADING SPECIAL EMISSIONS CONTROL AREA WHERE BUNKERS SULPHUR CONTENT TO BE MAX (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AS PER MARPOL ANNEX VI. MIXING/COMINGLING OF BUNKERS IS NOT ALLOWED. ULTRA-LOW SULPHUR BUNKER FUEL IS NOT ALLOWED TO BE SUPPLIED.
NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY OR INCOSISTENT PROVISION CONTAINED IN THE CHARTERPARTY. SLUDGE DISPOSAL/REMOVAL, IF ANY TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT (TIME/RISK/EXPENSE).
THE FOLLOWING BIMCO BUNKER CLAUSES FOR TIME CHARTERS ARE TO BE
INCORPORATED INTO THE CHARTER PARTY:
(A) BUNKERING PRIOR TO DELIVERY / REDELIVERY
(B) BUNKERING OPERATIONS AND SAMPLING
(C) BUNKER QUALITY AND LIABILITY
(D) FUEL TESTING PROGRAMME
(E) BUNKER FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2005
(F) TYPES AND QUANTITIES OF BUNKERS ON REDELIVERY
(G) BUNKER NON-LIEN CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES
(H) BIMCO ETS ALLOWANCES CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2022
SLUDGE REMOVAL, IF ANY, ALWAYS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT/TIME.

ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS
WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.
ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FOR OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.

FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, VESSEL SPEED/CONSUMPTION IS GIVEN AND DETERMINED BASIS GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS, NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4, AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS, WITH MINIMUM 24 HOURS STEAMING TIME.
ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.
ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FO   OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.
“ABOUT” IN SPEED AND CONSUMPTION REFERS TO AN ALLOWANCE OF LESS HALF A KNOT IN RELATION TO SPEED AND 5 PERCENT MORE ON BUNKERS CONSUMPTION.
NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES TO WEATHER CONDITIONS EXCEEDING GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS AND NO EXTRAPOLATIONS SHALL BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS. NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES WHEN BURNING RMF/RMG 180.

MASTER TO ROUTINELY INCREASE RPM TWICE DAILY (2X2HRS), TO BURN OFF INCREASED SOOT WHEN ORDERED TO NAVIGATE AT REDUCED RPM (ECO SPEED). IN CASES WHERE THE VESSEL WILL NEED TO TAKE ON OR DISCHARGE BALLAST IN A FRESH WATER PORT, THE VESSEL WILL BE REQUIRED TO TAKE ABOUT 200 MT SEA WATER IN THE AFT PEAK TANK. THIS MUST BE TAKEN ON BOARD PRIOR TO ARRIVAL AT THE PORT AND THE CARGO LIFT MAY BE CORRESPONDINGLY REDUCED AT CHARTERERS RISK AND EXPENSE.
OPL BUNKERING IS NOT ALLOWED.

OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.

ALL PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT ARE CALCULATED ON A GOOD WEATHER DAY BASIS 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS FROM NOON REPORT TO NOON REPORT.NO EXTRAPOLATIONS CAN BE MADE FOR OTHER WEATHER/SEA CONDITIONS THAN THOSE DESCRIBED ABOVE.
VESSEL MAY CONSUME EXTRA BUNKER WHEN EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER, HOLDS CLEANING, IN/OUT PORT, IN VERY COLD OR VERY WARM WATER, DURING LIGHTENING OPERATION / DOUBLE BANKING/BUNKERING OR OTHER OPERATIONS WHEN VESSEL NECESSARY TO HAVE THE ENGINE STANDBY OR ADDITIONAL A/E AND BOILER.
VESSEL CONSUMES MGO IN MAIN ENGINE, WHEN MANOEUVERING / NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW, NARROW, CONGESTED, RESTRICTED AND CONFINED WATERS / CANALS / RIVERS, ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, WITHIN SECA AREA, AND MAY ALSO BURN MGO WHEN STARTING/SWITCHING OFF AND RUNNING AUXILIARIES AT SEA OR PORT.
CHARTERERS SHALL ALSO ENSURE, PRIOR TO THE VESSEL ENTERING IN ANY OF THE EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS),TO SUPPLY THE VESSEL WITH SUFFICIENT QUANTITY OF LOW SULPHUR BUNKERS (THE SULPHUR CONTENT PURSUANT TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF ECAS) TO BE CONSUMED WHEN TRADING IN ECAS AREAS AT CHARTERERS RISK, TIME AND EXPENSES WITHOUT MIXING THIS FUEL WITH OTHER BUNKERS ON BOARD.  IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, "EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS)" MEAN THE AREAS DESIGNATED UNDER MARPOL ANNEX VI AND/OR ANY OTHER AREA WHERE A MAXIMUM FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT IS IMPOSED BY REGIONAL AND/OR NATIONAL AUTHORITIES. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.
FUEL OIL TO CONFORM WITH VLSFO-RMG380(MAX SULPHUR:0.5%) (ISO 8217:2017(E) STANDARD) / LSMGO-DMA (EXCEPT PP)(ISO8217:2017(E) STANDARD)(MAX SULPHUR :0.1%). CHARTERTERS SHALL PROVIDE OWNERS/VESSEL BUNKER COQ IN COMPLIANCE WITH ISO 8217:2017 WITH RELIABALE LABORTORY'S STAMP/SIGNATURE NOT LATER THAN 24 HOURS BEFORE COMMENTCEMENT OF BUNKERING, FAILING WHICH ALL CONSEQUENCES/LOSS TO BE ON CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT..

VESSEL MAY CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE FOR WARMING UP OF THE SYSTEM & START/ STOP, AND IN GENERATORS FOR START/CHANGEOVER.

VESSEL MAY ALSO CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE AND GENERATORS FOR

STEAMING IN/OUT OF PORT, SHIFTING BERTH/ANCHORAGE, NAVIGATING IN CONGESTED WATERS/INLAND WATERS/CHANNELS, NARROW WATERWAYS, AND/OR HEAVY TRAFFIC, DURING POOR VISIBILITY; DURING LOAD/DISCHARGING AT ANCHORAGE ON BARGES/LIGHTERS WITH BAD WEATHER AND /OR STRONG CURRENTS AND WHEN VLSFO IS DEEMED UNSAFE BY CHIEF ENGINEER.

FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, VESSEL SPPED/CONSUMPTION IS GIVEN AND DETERMINED BASIS GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS, NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4, AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS, WITH MINIMUM 24 HOURS STEAMING TIME.

ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS

WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.

ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FOR OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.

“ABOUT” IN SPEED AND CONSUMPTION REFERS TO AN ALLOWANCE OF LESS HALF A KNOT IN RELATION TO SPEED AND 5 PERCENT MORE ON BUNKERS CONSUMPTION.

NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES TO WEATHER CONDITIONS EXCEEDING GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS AND NO EXTRAPOLATIONS SHALL BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS. NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES WHEN BURNING RMF/RMG 180.

UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD ANY CLAIM BE DEDUCTED FROM HIRE UNTIL IS HAS BEEN AGREED BY BOTH PARTIES.

VESSEL PARTICIPATES IN BUNKER QUALITY SURVEY (VERIFUEL-BUREAU VERITAS)

BUNKER QUALITY: QUALITY OF BUNKERS SUPPLIED BY CHARTERERS SHALL BE: VLSFO (0.5% MAX SULPHUR)AS PER ISO 8217:2017 OR 2012 AND AS PER ISO PAS 23263:2019 WITH A MINIMUM VISCOSITY OF 3CST AT 50C BUT ALWAYS AS PER M/E SPEC, LSMGO (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AND ALWAYS TO COMPLY WITH MARPOL 73/78 REQUIREMENTS, REG 14, 18 OF ANNEX VI AND ANY SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS THERETO.

WHEN TRADING SPECIAL EMISSIONS CONTROL AREA WHERE BUNKERS SULPHUR CONTENT TO BE MAX (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AS PER MARPOL ANNEX VI. MIXING/COMINGLING OF BUNKERS IS NOT ALLOWED. ULTRA-LOW SULPHUR BUNKER FUEL IS NOT ALLOWED TO BE SUPPLIED.

NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY OR INCOSISTENT PROVISION CONTAINED IN THE CHARTERPARTY. SLUDGE DISPOSAL/REMOVAL, IF ANY TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT (TIME/RISK/EXPENSE).

THE FOLLOWING BIMCO BUNKER CLAUSES FOR TIME CHARTERS ARE TO BE

INCORPORATED INTO THE CHARTER PARTY:

ANY STEAMING DAYS WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE GOOD WEATHER ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATION OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED.
NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVORABLE CURRENTS, AND ALWAYS EXCLUDING ANY TIME DURING WHICH (i) REDUCTION OF SPEED IS NECESSARY FOR SAFETY DUE TO NAVIGATION IN CNGESTED WATERS OR POOR VISIBILITY; (ii) ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DEBALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF CARGO HOLDS; (iii) WHEN VESSEL IS MANOEUVRING WITHIN HARBOUR, INLAND WATERS, CHANNELS, WHERE SLOW SPEED IS REQUIRED DUE TO NATIONAL/INTERNATIONAL AND LOCAL REGULATIONS AND ALL TIMES WHEN PILOT IS ON BOARD; (iv) WHEN VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPERNATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS.
ANY GAIN ON TIME AND/OR CONSUMPTION TO BE OFF-SET AGAINST LOSS ON TIME AND/OR CONSUMPTION IF ANY.
ABOUT TO MEAN AS -0.5 KNOT  DOWNWARDS ON THE SPEED AND +5% UPWARDS ON THE TOTAL CONSUMPTION.
EXTRAPOLATION OF GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE FOR BAD WEATHER PERIOD IS NOT ALLOWED.
THE ABOVE FIGURES ARE EXCLUDE OCCASIONS OF BALLAST EXCHANGE AND BOILER.
OWNERS ONLY AGREE WITH THE VESSEL'S SLOW STEAMING WITHOUT ENTERING THE LEVEL OF AUX. BLOWER CONTINUOUS AUTO START/STOP SUBJECT TO THE VESSEL TO RUN AT FULL SPEED FOR MINIMUM 4 HOURS EVERYDAY.

SPEED/CONSUMPTION:

AT PORT WHEN IDLE: ABT 3 MTPD IFO AND ABT 0.1 MTPD MGO
AT PORT WORKING: ABOUT 6 MTPD IFO AND ABT 0.1 MTPD MGO
VESSEL MAY CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE FOR WARMING UP OF THE SYSTEM & START/ STOP, AND IN GENERATORS FOR START/CHANGEOVER.
VESSEL MAY ALSO CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE AND GENERATORS FOR
STEAMING IN/OUT OF PORT, SHIFTING BERTH/ANCHORAGE, NAVIGATING IN CONGESTED WATERS/INLAND WATERS/CHANNELS, NARROW WATERWAYS, AND/OR HEAVY TRAFFIC, DURING POOR VISIBILITY; DURING LOAD/DISCHARGING AT ANCHORAGE ON BARGES/LIGHTERS WITH BAD WEATHER AND /OR STRONG CURRENTS AND WHEN VLSFO IS DEEMED UNSAFE BY CHIEF ENGINEER.
FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, VESSEL SPPED/CONSUMPTION IS GIVEN AND DETERMINED BASIS GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS, NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4, AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS, WITH MINIMUM 24 HOURS STEAMING TIME.
ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS
WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.
ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FOR OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.
“ABOUT” IN SPEED AND CONSUMPTION REFERS TO AN ALLOWANCE OF LESS HALF A KNOT IN RELATION TO SPEED AND 5 PERCENT MORE ON BUNKERS CONSUMPTION.
NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES TO WEATHER CONDITIONS EXCEEDING GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS AND NO EXTRAPOLATIONS SHALL BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS. NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES WHEN BURNING RMF/RMG 180.
UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD ANY CLAIM BE DEDUCTED FROM HIRE UNTIL IS HAS BEEN AGREED BY BOTH PARTIES.
VESSEL PARTICIPATES IN BUNKER QUALITY SURVEY (VERIFUEL-BUREAU VERITAS)
BUNKER QUALITY: QUALITY OF BUNKERS SUPPLIED BY CHARTERERS SHALL BE: VLSFO (0.5% MAX SULPHUR)AS PER ISO 8217:2017 OR 2012 AND AS PER ISO PAS 23263:2019 WITH A MINIMUM VISCOSITY OF 3CST AT 50C BUT ALWAYS AS PER M/E SPEC, LSMGO (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AND ALWAYS TO COMPLY WITH MARPOL 73/78 REQUIREMENTS, REG 14, 18 OF ANNEX VI AND ANY SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS THERETO.
WHEN TRADING SPECIAL EMISSIONS CONTROL AREA WHERE BUNKERS SULPHUR CONTENT TO BE MAX (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AS PER MARPOL ANNEX VI. MIXING/COMINGLING OF BUNKERS IS NOT ALLOWED. ULTRA-LOW SULPHUR BUNKER FUEL IS NOT ALLOWED TO BE SUPPLIED.
NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY OR INCOSISTENT PROVISION CONTAINED IN THE CHARTERPARTY. SLUDGE DISPOSAL/REMOVAL, IF ANY TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT (TIME/RISK/EXPENSE).
THE FOLLOWING BIMCO BUNKER CLAUSES FOR TIME CHARTERS ARE TO BE
INCORPORATED INTO THE CHARTER PARTY:
(A) BUNKERING PRIOR TO DELIVERY / REDELIVERY
(B) BUNKERING OPERATIONS AND SAMPLING
(C) BUNKER QUALITY AND LIABILITY
(D) FUEL TESTING PROGRAMME
(E) BUNKER FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2005
(F) TYPES AND QUANTITIES OF BUNKERS ON REDELIVERY
(G) BUNKER NON-LIEN CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES
(H) BIMCO ETS ALLOWANCES CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2022
SLUDGE REMOVAL, IF ANY, ALWAYS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT/TIME.

ANY STEAMING DAYSWITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. PER DAY IN ADDITION TO MENTIONED ABOVE FOR VARIOUS PARAMETERS.VESSEL USUALLY RUNS ONLY ONE (1) AUXILARY ENGINE "AT SEA", HOWEVER OCCASIONALLY TWO (2) AUXILARY ENGINES MAY BE REQUIRED TO BE RUN, DUE TO BALLAST EXCHANGE OR SUCH AVCTIVITIES. FUEL CONSUMPTION MAY INCREASE DURING THIS PERIOD OF RUNNING TWO (2) AUXILARY ENGINES BY UP TO ABOUT 1.5 MT IFO PER DAY IN THE ABOVE STATED.PORT/ANCHORAGE CONSUMPTION IDLE            : ABT 4.0 MT IFO + 0.10 MT MGO WORKING    : ABT 6.0 MT IFO + 0.10 MT MGOBUNKER SPECIFICATION:IFO SPEC: RMG 380 CST ISO 8217:2010 UNTIL SUPERSEDED BY NEW STANDARDS.  LSMGO SPEC: DMB/A 8217:2010 UNTIL SUPERSEDED BY NEW STANDARDS. NOTE: VESSEL IS NOT SCRUBBER FITTED AND BURNS IFO WITH NOT MORE THAN 0.5% SULPHUR CONTENT – IN ACCORDANCE WITH NEW IMO CONVENTION 2020 ON MARINE FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT. ABOVE SPEED AND CONSUMPTION FIGURES ARE BASIS SUMMER DRAFT, EVEN KEEL, NO DECK CARGO, VALID only UNDER GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS UPTO/INCL BEAUFORT SCALE 4 AND/OR DOUGLAS SEA STATES SCALE 3 AND SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT MAX 1.25M, WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENT/ NEGATIVE INFLUENCE OF SWELL IN DEEP WATER OF MIN 7 TIMES SHIP’S DRAFT, SEA TEMPERATURE OF MAX 28°C AND BASIS CLEAN/SMOOTH HULL AND PROPELLER.VESSEL MANEUVERS WITH MAIN ENGINE + 2 AUXILIARY ENGINES RUNNING SIMULTANEOUSLY CONSUMING IFO 380 CST FUEL DURING ARRIVAL/DEPARTURE PORTS/ANCHORAGES AND SHIFTING BERTHS AS ALSO DURING PERIODS OF RESTRICTED VISIBILITY AND NARROW/SHALLOW WATERWAYS/RIVERS ETC. SPEED/CONSUMPTION BASED ON CLEAN BOTTOM ，WITHOUT DECK CARGO AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS WHICH MEANS:WINDS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 / DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3(MAXIMUM SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT 1.25M) AND NO AFFECT OF SEA AND CURRENT AND NO INFLUENCE OF SWELL AND ADVERSE CURRENT."ABT" MEANS 0.5 KN DECREASE IN SPEED & 5% INCREASE IN CONSUMPTION. ALL PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT ARE CALCULATED ON A GOOD WEATHER DAY BASIS 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS FROM NOON REPORT TO NOON REPORT.NO EXTRAPOLATIONS CAN BE MADE FOR OTHER WEATHER/SEA CONDITIONS THAN THOSE DESCRIBED ABOVE.
VESSEL MAY CONSUME EXTRA BUNKER WHEN EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER, HOLDS CLEANING, IN/OUT PORT, IN VERY COLD OR VERY WARM WATER, DURING LIGHTENING OPERATION / DOUBLE BANKING/BUNKERING OR OTHER OPERATIONS WHEN VESSEL NECESSARY TO HAVE THE ENGINE STANDBY OR ADDITIONAL A/E AND BOILER.
VESSEL CONSUMES MGO IN MAIN ENGINE, WHEN MANOEUVERING / NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW, NARROW, CONGESTED, RESTRICTED AND CONFINED WATERS / CANALS / RIVERS, ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, WITHIN SECA AREA, AND MAY ALSO BURN MGO WHEN STARTING/SWITCHING OFF AND RUNNING AUXILIARIES AT SEA OR PORT.
CHARTERERS SHALL ALSO ENSURE, PRIOR TO THE VESSEL ENTERING IN ANY OF THE EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS),TO SUPPLY THE VESSEL WITH SUFFICIENT QUANTITY OF LOW SULPHUR BUNKERS (THE SULPHUR CONTENT PURSUANT TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF ECAS) TO BE CONSUMED WHEN TRADING IN ECAS AREAS AT CHARTERERS RISK, TIME AND EXPENSES WITHOUT MIXING THIS FUEL WITH OTHER BUNKERS ON BOARD.  IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, "EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS)" MEAN THE AREAS DESIGNATED UNDER MARPOL ANNEX VI AND/OR ANY OTHER AREA WHERE A MAXIMUM FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT IS IMPOSED BY REGIONAL AND/OR NATIONAL AUTHORITIES. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.
FUEL OIL TO CONFORM WITH VLSFO-RMG380(MAX SULPHUR:0.5%) (ISO 8217:2017(E) STANDARD) / LSMGO-DMA (EXCEPT PP)(ISO8217:2017(E) STANDARD)(MAX SULPHUR :0.1%). CHARTERTERS SHALL PROVIDE OWNERS/VESSEL BUNKER COQ IN COMPLIANCE WITH ISO 8217:2017 WITH RELIABALE LABORTORY'S STAMP/SIGNATURE NOT LATER THAN 24 HOURS BEFORE COMMENTCEMENT OF BUNKERING, FAILING WHICH ALL CONSEQUENCES/LOSS TO BE ON CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT..

VESSEL MAY CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE FOR WARMING UP OF THE SYSTEM & START/ STOP, AND IN GENERATORS FOR START/CHANGEOVER.
VESSEL MAY ALSO CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE AND GENERATORS FOR
STEAMING IN/OUT OF PORT, SHIFTING BERTH/ANCHORAGE, NAVIGATING IN CONGESTED WATERS/INLAND WATERS/CHANNELS, NARROW WATERWAYS, AND/OR HEAVY TRAFFIC, DURING POOR VISIBILITY; DURING LOAD/DISCHARGING AT ANCHORAGE ON BARGES/LIGHTERS WITH BAD WEATHER AND /OR STRONG CURRENTS AND WHEN VLSFO IS DEEMED UNSAFE BY CHIEF ENGINEER.
FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, VESSEL SPPED/CONSUMPTION IS GIVEN AND DETERMINED BASIS GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS, NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4, AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS, WITH MINIMUM 24 HOURS STEAMING TIME.
ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS
WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.
ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FOR OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.
“ABOUT” IN SPEED AND CONSUMPTION REFERS TO AN ALLOWANCE OF LESS HALF A KNOT IN RELATION TO SPEED AND 5 PERCENT MORE ON BUNKERS CONSUMPTION.
NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES TO WEATHER CONDITIONS EXCEEDING GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS AND NO EXTRAPOLATIONS SHALL BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS. NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES WHEN BURNING RMF/RMG 180.
UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD ANY CLAIM BE DEDUCTED FROM HIRE UNTIL IS HAS BEEN AGREED BY BOTH PARTIES.
VESSEL PARTICIPATES IN BUNKER QUALITY SURVEY (VERIFUEL-BUREAU VERITAS)
BUNKER QUALITY: QUALITY OF BUNKERS SUPPLIED BY CHARTERERS SHALL BE: VLSFO (0.5% MAX SULPHUR)AS PER ISO 8217:2017 OR 2012 AND AS PER ISO PAS 23263:2019 WITH A MINIMUM VISCOSITY OF 3CST AT 50C BUT ALWAYS AS PER M/E SPEC, LSMGO (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AND ALWAYS TO COMPLY WITH MARPOL 73/78 REQUIREMENTS, REG 14, 18 OF ANNEX VI AND ANY SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS THERETO.
WHEN TRADING SPECIAL EMISSIONS CONTROL AREA WHERE BUNKERS SULPHUR CONTENT TO BE MAX (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AS PER MARPOL ANNEX VI. MIXING/COMINGLING OF BUNKERS IS NOT ALLOWED. ULTRA-LOW SULPHUR BUNKER FUEL IS NOT ALLOWED TO BE SUPPLIED.
NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY OR INCOSISTENT PROVISION CONTAINED IN THE CHARTERPARTY. SLUDGE DISPOSAL/REMOVAL, IF ANY TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT (TIME/RISK/EXPENSE).
THE FOLLOWING BIMCO BUNKER CLAUSES FOR TIME CHARTERS ARE TO BE
INCORPORATED INTO THE CHARTER PARTY:
(A) BUNKERING PRIOR TO DELIVERY / REDELIVERY
(B) BUNKERING OPERATIONS AND SAMPLING
(C) BUNKER QUALITY AND LIABILITY
(D) FUEL TESTING PROGRAMME
(E) BUNKER FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2005
(F) TYPES AND QUANTITIES OF BUNKERS ON REDELIVERY
(G) BUNKER NON-LIEN CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES
(H) BIMCO ETS ALLOWANCES CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2022
SLUDGE REMOVAL, IF ANY, ALWAYS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT/TIME.

STEAMING IN/OUT OF PORT, SHIFTING BERTH/ANCHORAGE, NAVIGATING IN CONGESTED WATERS/INLAND WATERS/CHANNELS, NARROW WATERWAYS, AND/OR HEAVY TRAFFIC, DURING POOR VISIBILITY; DURING LOAD/DISCHARGING AT ANCHORAGE ON BARGES/LIGHTERS WITH BAD WEATHER AND /OR STRONG CURRENTS AND WHEN VLSFO IS DEEMED UNSAFE BY CHIEF ENGINEER.
FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, VESSEL SPPED/CONSUMPTION IS GIVEN AND DETERMINED BASIS GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS, NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4, AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS, WITH MINIMUM 24 HOURS STEAMING TIME.
ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS
WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.
ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FOR OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.
“ABOUT” IN SPEED AND CONSUMPTION REFERS TO AN ALLOWANCE OF LESS HALF A KNOT IN RELATION TO SPEED AND 5 PERCENT MORE ON BUNKERS CONSUMPTION.
NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES TO WEATHER CONDITIONS EXCEEDING GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS AND NO EXTRAPOLATIONS SHALL BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS. NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES WHEN BURNING RMF/RMG 180.
UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD ANY CLAIM BE DEDUCTED FROM HIRE UNTIL IS HAS BEEN AGREED BY BOTH PARTIES.
VESSEL PARTICIPATES IN BUNKER QUALITY SURVEY (VERIFUEL-BUREAU VERITAS)
BUNKER QUALITY: QUALITY OF BUNKERS SUPPLIED BY CHARTERERS SHALL BE: VLSFO (0.5% MAX SULPHUR)AS PER ISO 8217:2017 OR 2012 AND AS PER ISO PAS 23263:2019 WITH A MINIMUM VISCOSITY OF 3CST AT 50C BUT ALWAYS AS PER M/E SPEC, LSMGO (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AND ALWAYS TO COMPLY WITH MARPOL 73/78 REQUIREMENTS, REG 14, 18 OF ANNEX VI AND ANY SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS THERETO.
WHEN TRADING SPECIAL EMISSIONS CONTROL AREA WHERE BUNKERS SULPHUR CONTENT TO BE MAX (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AS PER MARPOL ANNEX VI. MIXING/COMINGLING OF BUNKERS IS NOT ALLOWED. ULTRA-LOW SULPHUR BUNKER FUEL IS NOT ALLOWED TO BE SUPPLIED.
NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY OR INCOSISTENT PROVISION CONTAINED IN THE CHARTERPARTY. SLUDGE DISPOSAL/REMOVAL, IF ANY TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT (TIME/RISK/EXPENSE).

SPEED/CONSUMPTION BASED ON CLEAN BOTTOM ，WITHOUT DECK CARGO AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS WHICH MEANS:WINDS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 / DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3(MAXIMUM SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT 1.25M) AND NO AFFECT OF SEA AND CURRENT AND NO INFLUENCE OF SWELL AND ADVERSE CURRENT."ABT" MEANS 0.5 KN DECREASE IN SPEED & 5% INCREASE IN CONSUMPTION. VESSEL MAY CONSUME EXTRA BUNKER WHEN EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER, HOLDS CLEANING, IN/OUT PORT, IN VERY COLD OR VERY WARM WATER, DURING LIGHTENING OPERATION / DOUBLE BANKING/BUNKERING OR OTHER OPERATIONS WHEN VESSEL NECESSARY TO HAVE THE ENGINE STANDBY OR ADDITIONAL A/E AND BOILER.

 

VESSEL CONSUMES MGO IN MAIN ENGINE, WHEN MANOEUVERING / NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW, NARROW, CONGESTED, RESTRICTED AND CONFINED WATERS / CANALS / RIVERS, ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, WITHIN SECA AREA, AND MAY ALSO BURN MGO WHEN STARTING/SWITCHING OFF AND RUNNING AUXILIARIES AT SEA OR PORT.

IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, "EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS)" MEAN THE AREAS DESIGNATED UNDER MARPOL ANNEX VI AND/OR ANY OTHER AREA WHERE A MAXIMUM FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT IS IMPOSED BY REGIONAL AND/OR NATIONAL AUTHORITIES. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY.

Speed and consumption figures basis up to summer draft, even keel (for laden passages) good weather conditions up to max Beaufort 4, and/or significant wave height up to 1.25mtrs and no adverse influence of currents, the first 24 hours and last 24 hours of any sea passage being excluded, also excluding periods with reduction of speed, in straits, in tidal affected waters, high risk piracy areas, due to reasons of safety/visibility or on charterers’ orders.

Any savings in fuel consumption to be set off against any loss of time and vice versa.

When working – about 5.50 tonnes VLSFO (basis 24 hrs working)

Fuel Quality

Charterers undertake to supply only fuel and diesel/gasoil complying with current ISO specifications at the time of supply.

VLSFO - 380 Centistoke ISO 8217:2017 (E) RMG 380 with max sulphur 0.50% Ultra Low Sulphur Marine Gas Oil (ULSMGO)

with max sulphur 0.10% grade DMA 8217:2017 Min FIA/100 20 ECN (IP541). VLSFO purchased/supplied in different lots must be segregated.

All Fuel shall consist of hydrocarbons derived from petroleum sources and shall not contain any anomalous components (such as Tall Oil and/or Inorganic Acid Substances) and to be of a stable and homogenous nature.

Fuel has to be free of waste lubricants, chemicals and chemical wastes. Cold flow characteristics of the fuel should be such that paraffin precipitation does not hinder operability of fuel system components. The fuel shall comply with the specifications of ISO 8217 Table 1 or 2 and to Clause 5 and the Revised Annex VI regulation 18.3. During bunkering, bunker suppliers to comply with reg 18 of Marpol Annex VI and the guidelines set out in IMO res Mepc.182(59) guidelines for representative drip samples to be drawn from ship’s manifold.

DEAR SIRSGD DAYPLS KINDLY PPS FOR:MV.ZHONG SHAN MEN 55.5K/16,UMM QASR 21-22ND/AUG  IAGW,NO IRAN/ISRAEL/YEMAN,PREFER BUSINESS TO F.E OR S.E.ASIA,BOD RVTGMV.WANG DA 38K/16,JEDDAH ARD 11TH/SEPT  IAGW,NO IRAN/ISRAEL/YEMAN,PREFER BUSINESS TO CHINA DIRECTLY,TRY F.E OR S.E.ASIA,BOD RVTGM/V ZHONG SHAN MEN PANAMA FLAG, LR CLASS, 2016 BUILTSUMMER DWT 55,449.10 MT ON 12.9 M/TPC 58.8MTGT/NT 34,859/17,303LOA/BEAM 189.99 / 32.25 M4 X 45 MT CRANE, 4 X(6-12) CBM GRAB FITTED (REMOTE CONTROL)G/B(BSS TWN DECK OPEN) 64306.87CBM/NILG/B(BSS TWN DECK CLOSED) NIL/66824.8CBMHOLD 2&4 TWIN DECK (FLUSH TD CAN BE REGARDED AS SINGLE DECK FOR BULK CARGO), OTHERS SD5H/5HSPEED/ CONSUMPTION: BALLAST ABT 12.80KN ON ABT 21.00MT IFO 380CST (RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO LADEN ABT 12.00KN ON ABT 21.00MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO  PORT CONS:IDLE ABT 3.00MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ ABT 0.10MT MDO OR WORKING ABT 4.0MT BSS 12H OR ABT 5.00MT BSS 24H IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO ADDITIONAL ABT 0.5MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380) FOR IDLE OR WORKING IF THE AIR TEMPERATURE IS UNDER 15 CENTIGRADE(INCL) SPEED/CONSUMPTION BASED ON CLEAN BOTTOM ，WITHOUT DECK CARGO AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS WHICH MEANS:WINDS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 / DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3(MAXIMUM SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT 1.25M) AND NO AFFECT OF SEA AND CURRENT AND NO INFLUENCE OF SWELL AND ADVERSE CURRENT."ABT" MEANS 0.5 KN DECREASE IN SPEED & 5% INCREASE IN CONSUMPTION. FAVORABLE CURRENTS ALWAYS WORK TO OWNERS’ ADVANTAGE. ALL PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENT ARE CALCULATED ON A GOOD WEATHER DAY BASIS 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS FROM NOON REPORT TO NOON REPORT.NO EXTRAPOLATIONS CAN BE MADE FOR OTHER WEATHER/SEA CONDITIONS THAN THOSE DESCRIBED ABOVE. VESSEL MAY CONSUME EXTRA BUNKER WHEN EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER, HOLDS CLEANING, IN/OUT PORT, IN VERY COLD OR VERY WARM WATER, DURING LIGHTENING OPERATION / DOUBLE BANKING/BUNKERING OR OTHER OPERATIONS WHEN VESSEL NECESSARY TO HAVE THE ENGINE STANDBY OR ADDITIONAL A/E AND BOILER. VESSEL CONSUMES MGO IN MAIN ENGINE, WHEN MANOEUVERING / NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW, NARROW, CONGESTED, RESTRICTED AND CONFINED WATERS / CANALS / RIVERS, ENTERING / LEAVING PORTS/CANALS, WITHIN SECA AREA, AND MAY ALSO BURN MGO WHEN STARTING/SWITCHING OFF AND RUNNING AUXILIARIES AT SEA OR PORT. CHARTERERS SHALL ALSO ENSURE, PRIOR TO THE VESSEL ENTERING IN ANY OF THE EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS),TO SUPPLY THE VESSEL WITH SUFFICIENT QUANTITY OF LOW SULPHUR BUNKERS (THE SULPHUR CONTENT PURSUANT TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF ECAS) TO BE CONSUMED WHEN TRADING IN ECAS AREAS AT CHARTERERS RISK, TIME AND EXPENSES WITHOUT MIXING THIS FUEL WITH OTHER BUNKERS ON BOARD.  IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT THE LOW SULPHUR BUNKER QUANTITY REQUIRED FOR CHANGE-OVER FROM HIGH TO LOW SULPHUR BUNKER PRIOR ENTERING IN ECAS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT AS WELL. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, "EMISSION CONTROL AREAS (ECAS)" MEAN THE AREAS DESIGNATED UNDER MARPOL ANNEX VI AND/OR ANY OTHER AREA WHERE A MAXIMUM FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT REQUIREMENT IS IMPOSED BY REGIONAL AND/OR NATIONAL AUTHORITIES. THE CHARTERERS MAY GIVE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE MASTER - WITH COPY TO OWNERS -FOR SLOW STEAMING, SUBJECT ALWAYS TO MASTER’S OBLIGATIONS IN RESPECT OF THE SAFETY OF THE CREW, VESSEL AND CARGO, WHEREOF IN ANY CASE OWNERS NOT TO BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY PERFORMANCE SHORTFALL. FURTHERMORE, PROLONGED PERIODS OF SLOW STEAM, ARE SUBJECT TO VESSEL’S MAIN ENGINE MINIMUM RPM RESTRICTIONS AS IMPOSED BY ENGINE MAKERS AND/OR ANY OTHER PARAMETERS WHICH MAY AFFECT THE CONDITION OF THE MAIN ENGINE DUE TO CONTINUOUS RUNNING WITH LOW RPM. OWNERS/MASTER/CH.ENGINEER, ARE ENTITLED TO REVERT TO VESSEL’S SERVICE SPEED WHEN SAME IS DEEMED NECESSARY FOR MAINTAINING ENGINES’ INTEGRITY AND VESSEL’S  SAFETY. FUEL OIL TO CONFORM WITH VLSFO-RMG380(MAX SULPHUR:0.5%) (ISO 8217:2017(E) STANDARD) / LSMGO-DMA (EXCEPT PP)(ISO8217:2017 (E) STANDARD)(MAX SULPHUR :0.1%). CHARTERTERS SHALL PROVIDE OWNERS/VESSEL BUNKER COQ IN COMPLIANCE WITH ISO 8217:2017 WITH RELIABALE LABORTORY'S STAMP/SIGNATURE NOT LATER THAN 24 HOURS BEFORE COMMENTCEMENT OF BUNKERING, FAILING WHICH ALL CONSEQUENCES/LOSS TO BE ON CHARTERERS' ACCOUNT. ADAWANG DAPANAMA FLAG,NKK CLASS,2016 BLTSUMMER DWT 38225MT BSS 10.60M/TPC 51.7MTGT/NT 24750/12765,TPC 51.7LOA/BEAM:179.90/30.00M4*36MT CRANE ,4*(6-12)CBM GRAB(REMOTE CONTROL)G/B (BSS TWN DEC OPEN) 45108.80CBM/NILG/B(BSS TWN DECK CLOSED) 46516.30/44728.8CBMHOLD 2&4 TWIN DECK (FLUSH TD CAN BE REGARDED AS SINGLE DECK FOR BULK CARGO),OTHERS SD5H/5HSPEED/ CONSUMPTION: FULL SPEED/CONS:BALLAST/LADEN ABT 12.50KN/ABT 12.20KN ON ABT 20.00MT IFO 380CST (RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO ECO:BALLAST/LADEN ABT 11.70KN/ABT 11.70KN ON ABT 17.50MT/ABT 18.00MT IFO 380CST (RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO PORT CONS:IDLE ABT 2.80MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ ABT 0.10MT MDO OR WORKING ABT 3.8MT BSS 12H OR  5.00MT BSS 24H IFO 380CST(RMG 380)+ABT 0.10MT MDO ADDITIONAL ABT 0.5MT IFO 380CST(RMG 380) FOR IDLE OR WORKING IF THE AIR TEMPERATURE IS UNDER 15 CENTIGRADE(INCL) SPEED/CONSUMPTION BASED ON CLEAN BOTTOM ，WITHOUT DECK CARGO AND GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS WHICH MEANS:WINDS UP TO AND INCLUDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4 / DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3(MAXIMUM SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT 1.25M) AND NO AFFECT OF SEA AND CURRENT AND NO INFLUENCE OF SWELL AND ADVERSE CURRENT."ABT" MEANS 0.5 KN DECREASE IN SPEED & 5% INCREASE IN CONSUMPTION. SPEED/CONSUMPTION:
BALLAST: ABT 13 KNTS ON ABT 20 MTPD IFO AND ABT 0.1 MTPD MGO
LADEN: ABT 12.5 KNTS ON ABT 21 MTPD IFO AND ABT 0.1 MTPD MGO
AT PORT WHEN IDLE: ABT 3 MTPD IFO AND ABT 0.1 MTPD MGO
AT PORT WORKING: ABOUT 6 MTPD IFO AND ABT 0.1 MTPD MGO
VESSEL MAY CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE FOR WARMING UP OF THE SYSTEM & START/ STOP, AND IN GENERATORS FOR START/CHANGEOVER.
VESSEL MAY ALSO CONSUME MGO IN MAIN ENGINE AND GENERATORS FOR
STEAMING IN/OUT OF PORT, SHIFTING BERTH/ANCHORAGE, NAVIGATING IN CONGESTED WATERS/INLAND WATERS/CHANNELS, NARROW WATERWAYS, AND/OR HEAVY TRAFFIC, DURING POOR VISIBILITY; DURING LOAD/DISCHARGING AT ANCHORAGE ON BARGES/LIGHTERS WITH BAD WEATHER AND /OR STRONG CURRENTS AND WHEN VLSFO IS DEEMED UNSAFE BY CHIEF ENGINEER.
FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, VESSEL SPPED/CONSUMPTION IS GIVEN AND DETERMINED BASIS GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS, NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE 4, AND COMBINED SIGNIFICANT WAVE HEIGHT NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS, WITH MINIMUM 24 HOURS STEAMING TIME.
ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS
WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. NO CURRENT FACTOR ON QUALIFIED GOOD WEATHER DAYS CAN BE APPLIED FOR FAVOURABLE CURRENTS. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.
ANY TIME LOSS DUE TO UNDER-PERFORMANCE CAN BE OFFSET BY UNDER-CONSUMPTION. SIMILARLY, ANY OVERCONSUMPTION CAN BE OFFSET BY ANY TIME GAINED. DIESEL OIL UNDERCONSUMPTION CAN BE USED TO OFFSET FOR OVER-CONSUMPTION/UNDER-PERFORMANCE.
“ABOUT” IN SPEED AND CONSUMPTION REFERS TO AN ALLOWANCE OF LESS HALF A KNOT IN RELATION TO SPEED AND 5 PERCENT MORE ON BUNKERS CONSUMPTION.
NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES TO WEATHER CONDITIONS EXCEEDING GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS AND NO EXTRAPOLATIONS SHALL BE MADE FOR WEATHER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS. NO SPEED AND CONSUMPTION WARRANTY APPLIES WHEN BURNING RMF/RMG 180.
UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD ANY CLAIM BE DEDUCTED FROM HIRE UNTIL IS HAS BEEN AGREED BY BOTH PARTIES.
VESSEL PARTICIPATES IN BUNKER QUALITY SURVEY (VERIFUEL-BUREAU VERITAS)
BUNKER QUALITY: QUALITY OF BUNKERS SUPPLIED BY CHARTERERS SHALL BE: VLSFO (0.5% MAX SULPHUR)AS PER ISO 8217:2017 OR 2012 AND AS PER ISO PAS 23263:2019 WITH A MINIMUM VISCOSITY OF 3CST AT 50C BUT ALWAYS AS PER M/E SPEC, LSMGO (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AND ALWAYS TO COMPLY WITH MARPOL 73/78 REQUIREMENTS, REG 14, 18 OF ANNEX VI AND ANY SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS THERETO.
WHEN TRADING SPECIAL EMISSIONS CONTROL AREA WHERE BUNKERS SULPHUR CONTENT TO BE MAX (0.1% MAX SULPHUR), AS PER MARPOL ANNEX VI. MIXING/COMINGLING OF BUNKERS IS NOT ALLOWED. ULTRA-LOW SULPHUR BUNKER FUEL IS NOT ALLOWED TO BE SUPPLIED.
NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY OR INCOSISTENT PROVISION CONTAINED IN THE CHARTERPARTY. SLUDGE DISPOSAL/REMOVAL, IF ANY TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT (TIME/RISK/EXPENSE).
THE FOLLOWING BIMCO BUNKER CLAUSES FOR TIME CHARTERS ARE TO BE
INCORPORATED INTO THE CHARTER PARTY:
(A) BUNKERING PRIOR TO DELIVERY / REDELIVERY
(B) BUNKERING OPERATIONS AND SAMPLING
(C) BUNKER QUALITY AND LIABILITY
(D) FUEL TESTING PROGRAMME
(E) BUNKER FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2005
(F) TYPES AND QUANTITIES OF BUNKERS ON REDELIVERY
(G) BUNKER NON-LIEN CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES
(H) BIMCO ETS ALLOWANCES CLAUSE FOR TIME CHARTER PARTIES 2022
SLUDGE REMOVAL, IF ANY, ALWAYS TO BE FOR CHARTERERS ACCOUNT/TIME.
